intro: Ternstroemia toquian, commonly known as the Toquian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically alternate, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Ternstroemia toquian is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
